Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
  Vertex

public class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object

The Vertex class represents a location with an integer x and y coordinate.

Author:
Kevin Scroggins

toPoint

public java.awt.Point toPoint()
Creates a Point object from the coordinates stored in the current Vertex and returns it.

Returns:

parseFrom

public static Vertex parseFrom(java.lang.String input)
Creates a Vertex object from a specified String and returns it. Parses the Vertex from a String of the form: "x, y" where x and y are the corresponding coordinates of the Vertex.

Parameters:
input - the String to parse the Vertex from.
Returns:
the Vertex parsed from the String.

writeTo

public void writeTo(java.io.PrintWriter out)
             throws java.io.IOException
Writes the Vertex to the specified PrintWriter. Outputs the Vertex to the form: "x, y" where x and y are the corresponding coordinates of the current Vertex.

Parameters:
out - the PrintWriter to write the Vertex to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was an error writing to the output stream.

paintOn

public void paintOn(java.awt.Graphics g)
Renders the Vertex onto the specified Graphics object.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics object to render the Vertex onto.
